column4: evening folks, I setup ubuntu on my neighbour's computer,   she doesn't want her daughter to have admin permission but the daughter is the one that uses the computer most,   I set the updates to auto-download  ,  will the comp get updated from automaticly from the daughter,s account or will they still need to login to the admin account to install the updates ?
make sure her account is not a member of sudo
it's not , I made sure
upgrade only
dist-upgrade is for kernel upgrades etc
please bother reading what ppl write,  he was asing his quesiton
he never said he'd tried it, so I was asking if he had or not
take a chill pill
it was a simple question
if he had he could have said "yes" and i'd move on
nice find :-)
ask.com pwns
http://linux.byexamples.com/archives/315/how-to-shutdown-and-reboot-without-sudo-password/
I recommend you run:   export EDITOR=nano    first
thanks
already running nano can't get the hang of vi
me neither
there are plenty of alternative desktops
unity is an ubuntu product. If you use other gnome3 based distros they will use gnome-shell more than likely
gnome-shell is installed, I just find gnome3 lacking in simplicity
i see. I've been and LXDE and KDE kinda guy. I find gnome too fussy. It has to do a little dance before it does anything
use to be you could rightclick on anything and get options,  no longer
still works here. You can even rightclick the unity bar items for a cheeky menu
its also a sea creature
